Description: ASTRA: Chelyabinsk conscripts received money for a contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense, which they did not sign. At least 10 conscripts from the Chebarkul military units of the 90th Guards Tank Division received transfers for allegedly signed contracts with the Ministry of Defense. They are concerned that in military units, conscripts en masse sign contracts in the very first days of service.Parents of conscripts are convinced: their children sign contracts under psychological pressure, and reports on the revocation of the document remain unheeded. In addition to the direct line, families turn to military prosecutors at various levels, human rights ombudsmen, courts and other authorities. So far, to no avail: nothing is known about examples of contract termination in Chebarkul.The initiators of the appeal say that conscripts are being encouraged to sign a contract on the way to the unit. Most recruits do not give in to persuasion, but they continue to be intensively convinced once in the military unit. In particular, threats to send them to the Belgorod or Kursk regions, from where the soldiers -will return with a load of 200.- If the serviceman continues to persist, he is offered to sign a -document- in order to remain in the Chebarkul units (in the military police, in the medical battalion, as drivers).The parents do not have the original or copies of the signed documents, but they believe that the fact of imprisonment military contract is confirmed by large amounts from 400 thousand to 2 million rubles received in the bank accounts of their children. From the name of these payments it is clear that we are talking about one-time payments for imprisonment agreement with the Ministry of Defense. Amounts vary as the conclusion passes through different regions. Officially transfer of money explained by a technical failure.The 90th Guards Tank is based in Chebarkul division. In 2022, its fighters took part in the attack on Kyiv, where parts of the division were ambushed, suffered heavy losses and took refuge in Bogdanovka, Brovary district. Title: üñº -The scale is catastrophic-. Residents of Anapa are eliminatin...
Description: -The scale is catastrophic.- Residents of Anapa are eliminating the consequences of tanker crashes on their ownASTRA spoke with volunteers who spent the whole day cleaning the beach in Anapa. They claim that, at least in their city, only they and local Cossacks removed oil products from the beach - the Emergency Situations Ministry employees did not help them.-They bought everything themselves, brought it in cars. Someone bought, for example, just a huge number of 120-liter basins. There are many people willing, but there is no equipment, not even clothes. Because we also went and realized that we had simply gotten away with everything. People are all standing in the dark. Shoes, clothes, it won‚Äôt wash off anything,- said volunteer Ilya.According to him, there is a stench on the beach. As a result, some of the volunteers feel sick - today they did not yet know about the smell and did not stock up on masks. Ilya is preparing for the fact that tomorrow there will be even more work, as there is a strong wind that will bring new fuel oil ashore.-We collected the fuel oil in bags. No one has taken them out yet. The Ministry of Emergency Situations will most likely give some instructions on this matter, but so far there are none. That is, our task for now is simply to localize, collect, drag and cover everything with sand, because the waves are strong, the water can get it all out and take it away overnight,- explains Ilya.The volunteer says, that not only residents of Anapa, but also visitors from other regions who spent the winter here came to the beach to help.-There are still no people. Therefore, of course, we need to help. We also have our own work. Now it's dark, we stopped working. At night everyone will come to their senses a little and tomorrow we will start again, because the water will only erode further and further. The scale here is catastrophic. The state, local businesses, and people need to somehow unite,- says Ilya. Fuel oil contains polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, many of which are proven carcinogens. Breathing fuel oil vapors causes irritation of the respiratory tract, coughing, shortness of breath and can lead to the development of bronchitis, pneumonia and other respiratory diseases. Fuel oil particles entering the lungs can cause fibrosis and other chronic diseases. Direct contact with fuel oil causes dermatitis, eczema and other skin diseases. Some components of fuel oil have neurotoxic properties that affect the nervous system. This can manifest itself in headaches, dizziness, weakness and other neurological symptoms.In the morning, Governor of the Krasnodar Territory Veniamin Kondratiev confirmed, that after the tanker crash -Volgoneft 239- and Volgoneft 212 washed up oil products on the coast. oil products washed ashore. An oil spill in the Kerch Strait after tanker crashes threatens a new environmental disaster, Greenpeace said earlier.üì∏ Send photo/video/information: @redastrabotASTRA reserve channel: https://t.me/astrapress2

What is known about the person who died as a resultexplosionof Lieutenant General Kirillov?Igor Kirillov born July 13, 1970 in Kostroma. There, in 1991, he graduated from the Kostroma Higher Military Command School of Chemical Defense and the Military Academy of Chemical Defense named after S.K. Timoshenko in 2007. From 1991 to 1995 he served as a platoon commander in the Western Group of Forces in Germany and the Moscow Military District. By 2009, Kirillov had risen to the position of commander of a separate NBC protection brigade, and then continued to serve in the Office of the Chief of the NBC Defense Troops of the Russian Armed Forces. From September 2014 to April 2017, Kirillov headed the Military Academy of Russian Chemical Defense named after S.K. Timoshenko, and in April 2017 he was appointed head of the radiation, chemical and biological defense forces of the RF Armed Forces. Igor Kirillov is called one of the developers of the TOS-2 Tosochka, which was later put into service. This is a flamethrower system using shells with a thermobaric or incendiary warhead.According to data from the patent database of the Federal Institute of Industrial Property, Igor Kirillov is one of the inventors of a set of reagents for detecting the RNA of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. During the coronavirus pandemic, Kirillov repeatedly expressedthe opinion that this pandemic is deliberate and the United States is involved in its occurrence. After the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Kirillov stated that a network of biological laboratories was discovered there, and the Ukrainian authorities, under the pretext of fighting Due to Covid, thousands of samples belonging to the -Slavic ethnic group- were sent to the United States with the aim of creating biological weapons. As he was leaving the entrance, a bomb planted in an electric scooter parked nearby exploded. In the BBC with links to sources they claim that the explosion was an operation of the Ukrainian special services.Kirillov is survived by his wife and two sons. Edition -We Can Explain- note that the eldest son, Ilya, was born in Germany, and the place of registration of members of the Kirillov family in many leaks is Frunzenskaya Embankment 22/2 in Moscow. The building of the Russian Ministry of Defense is located at this address. Title: The EU is preparing sanctions against the organizers of the hybri...
Description: The EU is preparing sanctions against the organizers of the Kremlin‚Äôs -hybrid operations-. Among them are Tina Kandelaki and employees of the presidential administration and the GRUSystem journalists (Radio Liberty project) prepareda partial list of Russians, against whom the European Union is preparing sanctions due to involvement in Russian hybrid operations in Europe and Africa. It will include 16 people and three companies.For example, the head of GC Structura LLC, Nikolai Tupikin, according to EU officials, headed the Doppelganger (-Double-) operation. This is a disinformation campaign launched after the start of the war in Ukraine and is aimed at audiences in the EU and the USA. It was used to publish fake news on websites imitating major international media and other authoritative sources.An employee of the Russian Presidential Administration, Sofya Zakharova, also participated in this campaign, who, among other things, may be associated with projects to discredit the Russian opposition , which for the first time became one of the reasons for the introduction of EU sanctions.The sanctions list, which has not yet been officially published, also included a former TV presenter, deputy general director Gazprom Media Tinatin (Tina) Kandelaki. It is alleged that it is engaged in propaganda justifying Russian aggression in Ukraine, and in the occupied territories its structures replaced Ukrainian TV channels with Russian ones.FSB officer Artem Kureev should be subject to EU sanctions - he launched propaganda projects Rusafro and African Initiative (- African Initiative-), spread disinformation accusing the West of -experiments to create bioweapons-, which talked about -genetically modified mosquitoes-, as well as the fact that Western companies, under the guise of vaccination, allegedly used the African population as a -free clinical base-.Another people on the list: GRU officers Yuri Sizov and Vladimir Lipchenko, who were allegedly involved in the creation of intelligence networks, arson and attacks on critical infrastructure in the EU countries and Ukraine. The sanctions should include GRU military unit 29155, headed by GRU Major General Andrei Averyanov. The unit's employees were associated with a number of European GRU operations. For example, in an investigation by the Czech weekly Respekt and Bellingcat it was said that the Russian military intelligence operation to organize sabotage at weapons depots in the Czech Republic in the fall of 2014 took place under the personal control of Averyanov. Averyanov himself leads operations in Africa to undermine democracy, the draft sanctions say. Russian forces may have mined gold in Mali to finance these operations, the document's authors claim.EU foreign ministers are due to approve the new sanctions list on December 16.

Title: üñº There is a shortage of saline solution in Russian pharmacies R...
Description: There is a shortage of saline solution in Russian pharmaciesReports of a shortage of saline solution have been coming from the Tyumen, Chelyabinsk, Sverdlovsk, Leningrad regions and Perm Territory since November of this year. -Fontanka- writes that in hospitals in St. Petersburg you have to wait in line for IVs for several months, or look for saline solution yourself. Pharmacies only stock small ampoules of 5-10 ml.-The volume of saline solution that the healthcare system receives has decreased sharply this year. For the first and third quarters of 2024, [issued] is 45% less than for the same period in 2023. The price is fixed by the state, but the cost has increased significantly. Water treatment systems and packaging materials are highly dependent on foreign suppliers,- said RNC Development Director Pharma Nikolay Bespalov. The total annual demand for saline solution is 50-60 million packages, he added. -If current production and supply volumes are maintained, the market will receive, at best, 37-38 million packages. This leads to a shortage in the market,- Bespalov explained.This week, for the first time, there is an official shortage of saline solution in Russia recognizedby the Ministry of Health. -As part of monitoring by Roszdravnadzor, risks of defects were identified. Suppliers have been found who are ready to supply the drug to regions in need. The situation with the re-registration of prices for sodium chloride is under control,- the department said. On Friday morning Roszdravnadzor reported that stocks currently amount to more than 9.4 million packages, -supplies of saline solution to medical organizations and pharmacies continue.- Sodium chloride is included in the list of vital and essential medicines for which fixed prices are set.
